div.l: This Meller haþ so wisely bibbed ale
That as an hors he snorteth in his slepe
Ne of his taylle be hynde he toke no kepe
His wif bar him a burdon a ful strong
Men myghten here rowtyng her on forlong
The wenche routeth ek ꝑpar companye
Alayn̄ þe clerk þat herd þis melodye
He powkede Iohn and seide slepist þow
Herdist þow eủere slik a sang as or now
Lo slik a couplyng is be twix hem alle
A wilde fyr on þaire bodyes falle
He herkened eủere swilk a ferly þing
Ye þei sall haue þe floure of ilke endyng
This lang nyght þer tides me na reste
But yet na force al schal be for þe beste
For Iohn seide he as eủere mote I pryue
Yf þat I may yon wenche wil I swyue
Som esement haþ lawe shapen vs
For Iohn þer is a lawe þat seiþe þus
That yf a man in oo poynt be a greued
That in an oþer he schal be releued
Oure corn is stolen sothly it ys no nay
And we han stoled an ille fit to day
And syn I shal haue noon amendement
A gayn my losse I wole haue esement
By goddes saule it shal non oþ̉er be
This Iohn answere Aleyn a vise þe
The a Meller is a ꝑperilous man he seide
And if þat he out of his slape a brayde
He myghte don vs boþe a vilany
Alayn answerd I counte him nouȝt a flye
And vp he rist and by þe wenche he crepte
This wenche lay vp right and faste slepte
Til he so nygh was or she myght spye
That it hadde ben to late for to crye
And shortly for to seyn þey were at on
